verses.verse: The burden <WH4853> of the desert <WH4057> of the sea. <WH3220> As whirlwinds <WH5492> in the south <WH5045> pass <WH2498> through; so it comes <WH935> from the desert, <WH4057> from a terrible <WH3372> land. <WH776>

A grievous <WH7186> vision <WH2380> is declared <WH5046> to me; the treacherous <WH898> dealer deals <WH6213> treacherously, <WH898> and the spoiler <WH7703> spoils. <WH7703> Go <WH5927> up, O Elam: <WH5867> besiege, <WH6696> O Media; <WH4074> all <WH3605> the sighing <WH585> thereof have I made to cease. <WH7673>

Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> are my loins <WH4975> filled <WH4390> with pain: <WH2479> pangs <WH6735> have taken <WH270> hold <WH270> on me, as the pangs <WH6735> of a woman that travails: <WH3205> I was bowed <WH5791> down at the hearing <WH8085> of it; I was dismayed <WH926> at the seeing <WH7200> of it.
My heart <WH3824> panted, <WH8582> fearfulness <WH6427> affrighted <WH1204> me: the night <WH5399> of my pleasure <WH2837> has he turned <WH7760> into fear <WH2731> to me.
Prepare <WH6186> the table, <WH7979> watch <WH6822> in the watchtower, <WH6844> eat, <WH398> drink: <WH8354> arise, <WH6965> you princes, <WH8269> and anoint <WH4886> the shield. <WH4043>
For thus <WH3541> has the LORD <WH136> said <WH559> to me, Go, <WH3212> set <WH5975> a watchman, <WH6822> let him declare <WH5046> what <WH834> he sees. <WH7200>

And he saw <WH7200> a chariot <WH7393> with a couple <WH6776> of horsemen, <WH6571> a chariot <WH7393> of asses, <WH2543> and a chariot <WH7393> of camels; <WH1581> and he listened <WH7181> diligently <WH7182> with much <WH7227> heed: <WH7182>

And he cried, <WH7121> A lion: <WH738> My lord, <WH136> I stand <WH5975> continually <WH8548> on the watchtower <WH4707> in the daytime, <WH3119> and I am set <WH5324> in my ward <WH4931> whole <WH3605> nights: <WH3915>

And, behold, <WH2009> here <WH2088> comes <WH935> a chariot <WH7393> of men, <WH376> with a couple <WH6776> of horsemen. <WH6571> And he answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559> Babylon <WH894> is fallen, <WH5307> is fallen; <WH5307> and all <WH3605> the graven <WH6456> images of her gods <WH430> he has broken <WH7665> to the ground. <WH776>

O my threshing, <WH4098> and the corn <WH1121> of my floor: <WH1637> that which <WH834> I have heard <WH8085> of the LORD <WH3068> of hosts, <WH6635> the God <WH430> of Israel, <WH3478> have I declared <WH5046> to you.
The burden <WH4853> of Dumah. <WH1746> He calls <WH7121> to me out of Seir, <WH8165> Watchman, <WH8104> what <WH4100> of the night? <WH3915> Watchman, <WH8104> what <WH4100> of the night? <WH3915>

The watchman <WH8104> said, <WH559> The morning <WH1242> comes, <WH857> and also <WH1571> the night: <WH3915> if <WH518> you will inquire, <WH1158> inquire <WH1158> you: return, <WH7725> come. <WH857>
The burden <WH4853> on Arabia. <WH6152> In the forest <WH3293> in Arabia <WH6152> shall you lodge, <WH3885> O you traveling <WH736> companies <WH736> of Dedanim. <WH1720>

The inhabitants <WH3427> of the land <WH776> of Tema <WH8485> brought <WH857> water <WH4325> to him that was thirsty, <WH6771> they prevented <WH6923> with their bread <WH3899> him that fled. <WH5074>
For they fled <WH5074> from the swords, <WH2719> from the drawn <WH5203> sword, <WH2719> and from the bent <WH1869> bow, <WH7198> and from the grievousness <WH3514> of war. <WH4421>

For thus <WH3541> has the LORD <WH136> said <WH559> to me, Within <WH5750> a year, <WH8141> according to the years <WH8141> of an hireling, <WH7916> and all <WH3605> the glory <WH3519> of Kedar <WH6938> shall fail: <WH3615>

And the residue <WH7605> of the number <WH4557> of archers, <WH7198> the mighty <WH1368> men of the children <WH1121> of Kedar, <WH6938> shall be diminished: <WH4591> for the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of Israel <WH3478> has spoken <WH1696> it.
